message: Hello, my name is Jessica. How can I help you today?
Hi Jessica, I’m considering telematics based insurance. Can you tell me how the black box works and if I can get discounts for safe driving?
I'd be happy to provide more details. Before we continue, can I confirm your full name for security purposes?
Sure, it’s Alex Carter.
Thanks, Alex. Can you confirm your email address?
alex.carter@email.com
Can you confirm your postal code?
It's XY45 8AB.

Thank you for verifying your details. Our telematics based insurance uses a small device, commonly called a black box, which is installed in your vehicle to monitor driving habits such as speed, braking, and mileage. Would you like to know how it impacts your premium?
Yes, how does it help reduce my costs?

By driving safely, such as maintaining smooth acceleration and braking, and staying within speed limits, you can earn discounts on your renewal premium. The safer you drive, the higher the potential savings.
Okay, but does it track my location all the time?

Yes, the black box collects location data, but it is used only for assessing driving behavior and helping in case of accidents. Your data is kept secure and private according to our data protection policy.
That makes sense. How is the black box installed?
Installation is simple. A technician will visit you to install the device, or you can choose a self-install option depending on your preference. It typically takes around 30 minutes.
Sounds easy. If I take telematics insurance, will there be any driving restrictions?
Some policies may have restrictions, such as curfews for driving late at night, which can impact your score. We also recommend avoiding harsh braking and rapid acceleration to maximize your benefits.
Got it. What’s the cost of adding telematics to my policy?
The telematics feature can be added for an initial fee of $50, with potential savings on renewal depending on your driving performance. Would you like me to add this to your policy?
Not right now, but thanks for the info!
You're very welcome, Alex. If you have any other questions, feel free to reach out. Have a great day!
